definition: to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
time and again/repeatedly/frequently
to fight/fight/war/battle
time and again/repeatedly/frequently
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: The invading army was discomfited in every battle.
sentences.chinese: 那支入侵的军队屡战屡败。

sentences.english: Few had any faith in his abilities. They were sure he would always fail.
sentences.chinese: 没有人相信他的能力，他们坚信格兰特将会屡战屡败。

sentences.english: Exporters to the EU often find themselves on the losing side of those judgments.
sentences.chinese: 根据欧盟现行的判断标准，出口商几乎是屡战屡败。

sentences.english: Perhaps someone failures, frustrated in life.
sentences.chinese: 或许有人屡战屡败，人生失意。

sentences.english: The qing dynasty navy often war often hurt, decided to rally the pirates.
sentences.chinese: 清廷水师屡战屡败，决定重整旗鼓收拾海盗。

definition: to keep on fighting despite continual setbacks (idiom)
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
thwarted/obstructed/setback
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
repeatedly/time and again
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to emerge victorious in every battle/to be ever-victorious
to hit a wall/(fig.) to hit a brick wall/to hit a snag/to have the door slammed in one's face
to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
downhearted/downcast/in despair
to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do
pinyin: gong1 wu2 bu4 ke4 , zhan4 wu2 bu4 sheng4
